A1.body: What is such a small pony doing alone at night in such rainy weather?
A1.speaker: Agent

A1(1).body: You must be a representative of an organization that helps zebras.
A1(1).speaker: Strikely

A1(2).body: Stop kidding me, you know why I'm here.
A1(2).speaker: Strikely

A2.body: You must be one of the ministry employees willing to sell information to our organization.
A2.speaker: Agent

A2(1).body: That's right. Did you bring the money?
A2(1).speaker: Strikely

A5.body: You can be sure [shows closed suitcase] You brought the documents?
A5.speaker: Agent

A3.body: I haven't the faintest idea. Maybe you just like to walk in the rain at night?
A3.speaker: Agent

A3(1).body: You're wrong. I'm here to sell you information.
A3(1).speaker: Strikely

A3(2).body: You guessed it. But other than that, I'm here to sell you information.
A3(2).speaker: Strikely

A3(3).body: You're wrong. I'm here to kill you!
A3(3).speaker: Strikely

A6.body: I was expecting somepony more significant. You'll do, too, though. The main thing is that you have the documents. By the way about them…
A6.speaker: Agent

A6(1).body: Show me the money first. Do you have them?
A6(1).speaker: Strikely

A4.body: Let me show you the way. See where I'm pointing? It's called “far away" okay? Either you tell me why you're here, or you go there.
A4.speaker: Agent

A4(1).body: I'm here to sell you information.
A4(1).speaker: Strikely

A4(3).body: You're going in there now, you bastard!
A4(3).speaker: Strikely

A5(2).body: I think I forgot it at home…
A5(2).speaker: Strikely

A5(3).body: Give me the suitcase, or you'll die!
A5(3).speaker: Strikely

A7.body: You don't like your life so much? Either you show the documents, or you leave here, and we have nothing more to do with you!
A7.speaker: Agent

A8.body: Great. Do you know why we're doing this? You keep asking questions like this.
A8.speaker: Agent

A7(2).body: Don't you understand any jokes at all? Here are your documents [show suitcase]
A7(2).speaker: Strikely

A7(3).body: I'm sick of it. You're going to die now!
A7(3).speaker: Strikely

A9.body: "You are ponies too, why do you betray your own nation?"
A9.speaker: Agent

A10.body: Do you want to know why?
A10.speaker: Agent

A10(2).body: I don't care. Give me the money, and we'll break up.
A10(2).speaker: Strikely

A10(3).body: Do you want to know why I want to shoot you right now? Let me tell you!
A10(3).speaker: Strikely

A11.body: We do not betray our nation. We're saving her.
A11.speaker: Agent

A11(1).body: Selling documents to the enemy? How do you save ponies with this?
A11(1).speaker: Strikely

A11(2).body: But in general, I changed my mind. I don't care. Give me the money.
A11(2).speaker: Strikely

A11(3).body: Damned saviors. Nopony will save toy, when my bullets hit you!
A11(3).speaker: Strikely

A12.body: Very easy. The government of our dear Equestria is been showing itself incompetent for a long time.
A12.speaker: Agent

A13.body: All their recent actions are already almost screaming that Princesses are mad.
A13.speaker: Agent

A14.body: They must be removed and replaced by those who are capable of ending the war.
A14.speaker: Agent

A15.body: It has been going on for many years, but neither side has gained an advantage.
A15.speaker: Agent

A16.body: We will always be equal opponents, building up each other's power at the same speed.
A16.speaker: Agent

A17.body: And patriotism? This is just a tool of politicians.
A17.speaker: Agent

A18.body: It's so easy to think they're the stupid villains out there, and we're the only good ones.
A18.speaker: Agent

A19.body: The truth is, it's all a lie. This war will destroy us all.
A19.speaker: Agent

A20.body: Perhaps, a few years before, it was possible to fix everything in an easier way.
A20.speaker: Agent

A21.body: But now things have gone too far. Do you agree?
A21.speaker: Agent

A22.body: I'm afraid it's not that simple. The thing is, you've been betrayed. I know you're a fake agent.
A22.speaker: Agent

A23.body: You want to know who? Ha, my dear, we don't give up our partners.
A23.speaker: Agent

A24.body: If you think I'm talkative, you haven't seen your traitor yet. He's a big talker - he gave away almost all of your intelligence, you didn't even have to persuade him!
A24.speaker: Agent

A25.body: But I can assure you, he's an asshole. Intends to make an attempt on one of the Ministers in a couple of days. Good luck with that.
A25.speaker: Agent

A27.body: I've already said too much. Although there's hardly anything you can do anyway…
A27.speaker: Agent

A14(1).body: Isn't victory the only sure outcome of this war?
A14(1).speaker: Strikely

A14(2).body: I see. Now give me the money.
A14(2).speaker: Strikely

A14(3).body: Princesses are infallible! The only thing to end here is your life, heretic!
A14(3).speaker: Strikely

A19(1).body: And this requires such drastic measures?
A19(1).speaker: Strikely

A19(2).body: Stop talking, give me the money.
A19(2).speaker: Strikely

A19(3).body: You're too talkative for a corpse. Let's fix it!
A19(3).speaker: Strikely

A21(1).body: Of course. Give me the money.
A21(1).speaker: Strikely

A21(2).body: No, but we're not here to argue about politics. Give me the money.
A21(2).speaker: Strikely

A22(2).body: Then why talk so much if you knew everything from the beginning?
A22(2).speaker: Strikely

A22(3).body: Enough talking then. Get your weapons out!
A22(3).speaker: Strikely

A26(1).body: Tell me who it is! I have to stop him!
A26(1).speaker: Strikely
